an1.394-574:2.1: 29 Another Chapter on a Finger Snap
an1.394-574:4.1: “If, mendicants, a mendicant develops the first absorption, even for the time of a finger snap, they are called
an1.394-574:4.2: a mendicant who does not lack absorption, who follows the Teacher’s instructions, who responds to advice, and who does not eat the country’s alms in vain.
an1.394-574:4.3: How much more so those who make much of it!”
an1.394-574:6.1: “If, mendicants, a mendicant develops the second … third … or fourth absorption … or the heart’s release by love … or the heart’s release by compassion … or the heart’s release by rejoicing … or the heart’s release by equanimity, even for the time of a finger snap …
an1.394-574:8.1: If a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body … feelings … mind … principles, keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world, even for the time of a finger snap …
an1.394-574:10.1: If they generate enthusiasm, try, make an effort, exert the mind, and endeavor so that bad, unwholesome qualities don’t arise, even for the time of a finger snap …
an1.394-574:10.2: If they generate enthusiasm, try, make an effort, exert the mind, and endeavor so that bad, unwholesome qualities that have arisen are given up, even for the time of a finger snap …
an1.394-574:10.3: If they generate enthusiasm, try, make an effort, exert the mind, and endeavor so that wholesome qualities that have not arisen do arise, even for the time of a finger snap …
an1.394-574:10.4: If they generate enthusiasm, try, make an effort, exert the mind, and endeavor so that wholesome qualities that have arisen remain, are not lost, but increase, mature, and are fulfilled by development, even for the time of a finger snap …
an1.394-574:12.1: If they develop the basis for psychic power that has samādhi due to enthusiasm, and active endeavor … the basis for psychic power that has samādhi due to energy, and active endeavor … the basis for psychic power that has samādhi due to higher mind, and active endeavor … the basis for psychic power that has samādhi due to inquiry, and active endeavor, even for the time of a finger snap …
an1.394-574:14.1: If they develop the faculty of faith … the faculty of energy … the faculty of mindfulness … the faculty of samādhi … the faculty of wisdom, even for the time of a finger snap …
an1.394-574:16.1: If they develop the power of faith … the power of energy … the power of mindfulness … the power of samādhi … the power of wisdom, even for the time of a finger snap …
an1.394-574:18.1: If they develop the awakening-factor of mindfulness … the awakening-factor of investigation of principles … the awakening-factor of energy … the awakening-factor of rapture … the awakening-factor of tranquility … the awakening-factor of samādhi … the awakening-factor of equanimity, even for the time of a finger snap …
an1.394-574:20.1: If they develop right view … right motivation … right speech … right action … right livelihood … right effort … right mindfulness … right samādhi, even for the time of a finger snap …
an1.394-574:22.1: Perceiving form internally, they see visions externally, limited, both pretty and ugly.
an1.394-574:22.2: Having mastered this, they are aware that:
an1.394-574:22.5: Perceiving form internally, they see visions externally, limitless, both pretty and ugly.
an1.394-574:22.6: Having mastered this, they are aware that:
an1.394-574:22.9: Not perceiving form internally, they see visions externally, limited, both pretty and ugly.
an1.394-574:22.10: Having mastered this, they are aware that:
an1.394-574:22.13: Not perceiving form internally, they see visions externally, limitless, both pretty and ugly.
an1.394-574:22.14: Having mastered this, they are aware that:
an1.394-574:22.17: Not perceiving form internally, they see visions externally that are blue, with blue color, blue hue, and blue tint.
an1.394-574:22.18: Having mastered this, they are aware that:
an1.394-574:22.21: Not perceiving form internally, they see visions externally that are yellow, with yellow color, yellow hue, and yellow tint.
an1.394-574:22.22: Having mastered this, they are aware that:
an1.394-574:22.25: Not perceiving form internally, they see visions externally that are red, with red color, red hue, and red tint.
an1.394-574:22.26: Having mastered this, they are aware that:
an1.394-574:22.29: Not perceiving form internally, they see visions externally that are white, with white color, white hue, and white tint.
an1.394-574:22.30: Having mastered this, they are aware that:
an1.394-574:24.1: Having form, they see visions … not perceiving form internally, they see visions externally … they’re focused only on beauty … going totally beyond perceptions of form, with the ending of perceptions of impingement, not focusing on perceptions of diversity, aware that ‘space is infinite’, they enter and remain in the dimension of infinite space … going totally beyond the dimension of infinite space, aware that ‘consciousness is infinite’, they enter and remain in the dimension of infinite consciousness … going totally beyond the dimension of infinite consciousness, aware that ‘there is nothing at all’, they enter and remain in the dimension of nothingness … going totally beyond the dimension of nothingness, they enter and remain in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception … going totally beyond the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, they enter and remain in the cessation of perception and feeling …
an1.394-574:26.1: They develop the meditation on universal earth … the meditation on universal water … the meditation on universal fire … the meditation on universal air … the meditation on universal blue … the meditation on universal yellow … the meditation on universal red … the meditation on universal white … the meditation on universal space … the meditation on universal consciousness …
an1.394-574:28.1: They develop the perception of ugliness … the perception of death … the perception of repulsiveness in food … the perception of dissatisfaction with the whole world … the perception of impermanence … the perception of suffering in impermanence … the perception of not-self in suffering … the perception of giving up … the perception of fading away … the perception of cessation …
an1.394-574:30.1: They develop the perception of impermanence … the perception of not-self … the perception of death … perception of repulsiveness in food … the perception of dissatisfaction with the whole world … the perception of a skeleton … the perception of the worm-infested corpse … the perception of the livid corpse … the perception of the split open corpse … the perception of the bloated corpse …
an1.394-574:32.1: They develop the recollection of the Buddha … the recollection of the Dharma … the recollection of the Saṅgha … the recollection of ethical conduct … the recollection of generosity … the recollection of the gods … mindfulness of breathing … the recollection of death … mindfulness of the body … the recollection of peace …”
an1.394-574:34.1: They develop the faculty of faith together with the first absorption … the faculty of energy … the faculty of mindfulness … the faculty of samādhi … the faculty of wisdom … the power of faith … the power of energy … the power of mindfulness … the power of samādhi … the power of wisdom together with the first absorption …
an1.394-574:36.1: Together with the second absorption … the third absorption … the fourth absorption … love … compassion … rejoicing … They develop the faculty of faith together with equanimity … They develop the faculty of energy … the faculty of mindfulness … the faculty of samādhi … the faculty of wisdom … the power of faith … the power of energy … the power of mindfulness … the power of samādhi … the power of wisdom …
an1.394-574:36.3: a mendicant who does not lack absorption, who follows the Teacher’s instructions, who responds to advice, and who does not eat the country’s alms in vain.
an1.394-574:36.4: How much more so those who make much of it!”
